captions.text:
Come on in,
sit down over here.

Death is just
a part of life.

Something we're all
destined to do.

But I was destined
to be your mama.
I did the best I could.

Well...I happen to believe
you make your own destiny.

You have to do the best
with what god gave you.

You're going to have
to figure that out
for yourself.

Life is a box
of chocolates, forrest.

You never know what
you're going to get.

<i>Mama always had a way</i>
<i>of explaining things</i>

And that's all I have
to say about that.

title: Life is a Box of Chocolates - Forrest Gump (7/9) Movie CLIP (1994) HD

comments.text:

comments.author: k den

comments.text:

comments.author: m sheppard

comments.text:
definitely one of tom hanks best movies by FAR. right up there with the 
green mile, captain phillips and castaway... the acting in this movie is 
amazing! you really feel for the characters that's missing in most movies 
today, and the movie has the perfect mixture of those sad and dramatic 
moments when you need them, but it also has those hilarious moments and 
one-liners when you need them. sure there are ALOT of great and amazing 
movies nowadays, but they don't come around as much as they used too. not 
like back then. overall, forrest gump has amazing acting, great and 
unforgettable characters, an amazing story, perfect soundtrack, hilarious 
humor, and dramatic moments when you need them, making this one of tom 
hank's finest movies... :D﻿

You know what's interesting? He asked what his destiny was, and his destiny

That's so nice because it was so realistic.﻿

comments.text:
+Philo Adrovia Christian love? No. A mother's love, but not a Christian 
one. A Christian love says, "If you're not homosexual, or do not commit any 
sins you've not repented for, we love you. However, if you're homosexual or 
commit any sins, we don't love you". If you're going to criticise Islam, 
you're going to have to be critical about Christianity, too. However, 
you're right that she didn't follow Islam. Just because she was a good 
person does not mean that she is representative of your religion, or even 
follows your religion for that matter.

comments.text:
This woman was the truest definition of a Mother against all odds she 
presevered,lets look at it from this perspective I mean c'mon can you 
imagine existing in 1950's as a single mother ? With a handicapped child 
the stack completely against you yet she faced death with a steady 
hand,raised a man in which everyone he touched he made better ...and even 
while dying she found a way to give him a foundation to continue on after 
her passing ... Forrest was truly blessed to have such a beautiful person 
as a mother ﻿

comments.author: Robert Stevenson

comments.text:
I agree with Forrest's mother about life being a box of chocolates. "You 
never know what you're gonna get."

That really inspires me every time... :)

Also, I can imagine her coming to life and telling Sally Field that 
although Sally probably didn't know it at first, she was destined to be an 
actress and bring her to life on the big screen, and that she did the best 
she could. 

"I did good, Mrs. Gump."

Then, after Mrs. Gump tells her that one makes their own destiny, Sally 
asks, "What's *my* destiny, Mrs. Gump?"

"You're going to have to figure that out for yourself. Life is a box of 
chocolates, Sally.. you never know what you're gonna get."

Sally gets tears in her eyes upon hearing this, while Mrs. Gump smiles. "I 
will miss you, Sally."

Plus, I can see Mrs. Gump telling the villains from all these Disney films 
(such as The Queen of Hearts from *Alice in Wonderland*, Dr. Facilier from *The 
Princess and the Frog* and Jafar from *Aladdin*, among others) that you 
make your own destiny, that death is a part of life - something we're all 
destined to do, and that life *is* a box of chocolates. They definitely 
would've listened to her if they wanted to, of course. :)﻿

in this movie, notice that sometime...another great scene is her as the mom 
saying good-bye to her son going to Vietnam. ....Her strong performance is 
huge to this movie.
